title: Junior Recruitment Officer Job at GN128 GN128 Solutions
Electrical and Electronics Engineer Job at Proforce Galaxies Limited
content:
Proforce Galaxies Limited - At the forefront of innovation and global connectivity, Proforce Galaxies is driven by a bold vision: To become the leading space and satellite technology solutions provider globally. We believe satellites do more than orbit the Earth — they connect its people, empower industries, and unlock new frontiers of opportunity.

We are a comprehensive space technology company committed to advancing capabilities across the entire value chain of space operations — upstream, midstream, and downstream. Our solutions span from cutting-edge spacecraft manufacturing to real-time data delivery and integrated surveillance systems on Earth, in the air, and beyond.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical and Electronics Engineer

Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	As an Electrical and Electronics Engineer, you will be at the heart of our technical operations, working on the design, development, and testing of electrical systems for space and terrestrial applications.
	Your expertise will be critical in ensuring that our satellite platforms, ground station equipment, and data infrastructure operate with precision, reliability, and safety.
	You’ll collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams including embedded systems engineers, mechanical engineers, and software developers to develop end-to-end integrated solutions across upstream (space hardware), midstream (ground control), and downstream (user applications) segments.


Key Responsibilities


	Satellite Systems Design: Design and prototype electrical systems for satellites including power distribution networks, solar energy systems, and battery management units.
	Ground Station Equipment: Develop and maintain hardware for ground-based systems such as RF transceivers, antenna control systems, and signal processing modules.
	Component Selection & Integration: Specify, select, and integrate microcontrollers, ASICs, sensors, and other electrical components for use in satellite and terrestrial systems.
	PCB Design & Development: Perform circuit design, schematic capture, and PCB layout using industry-standard tools such as Altium Designer, Cadence, or equivalent platforms.
	Testing & Compliance: Conduct rigorous testing and validation of electrical systems including EMI/EMC compliance, thermal cycling, and vibration/environmental stress tests.
	Collaborative Engineering: Work closely with embedded systems engineers to ensure hardware-software integration and compatibility, especially for avionics and ground communication systems.
	Support for Downstream Applications: Design electrical hardware for edge-processing units and IoT gateways that connect to satellite data services.
	Diagnostics & Troubleshooting: Identify and resolve electrical system faults during design, integration, testing, and operational deployment—including in-orbit scenarios.
	Documentation: Prepare and maintain engineering documentation, test procedures, compliance reports, and mission requirement validations.
	System-Level Collaboration: Participate in cross-functional engineering teams for system-level design reviews, safety audits, and mission planning operations.


Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in electrical systems development (preferably in aerospace, defense, or high-reliability environments).
	Hands-on experience with PCB design software (e.g., Altium, Cadence, Eagle).
	Solid understanding of RF design, power electronics, embedded systems, and sensor integration.
	Experience with regulatory and environmental testing standards (EMI/EMC, thermal, vibration, etc.).
	Familiarity with satellite systems, ground station operations, or IoT infrastructure is a plus.
	Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving ability, and teamwork skills.
	Proficiency in technical documentation and reporting.
	Passion for innovation and space technologies.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV, a portfolio or links to past projects, proof of hands-on experience to: hr@proforcegalaxies.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Job Vacancies at HTSF Global Nigeria Limited
content:
HTSF Global Nigeria Limited is a leading company dedicated to revolutionizing the agricultural and grocery shopping experience through our innovative e-commerce marketplace.HTSF Global was founded with a clear vision: to transform the Agriculture sector by delivering excellence in goods and services through technology. Our story began with Ayodeji Enitan's firsthand experience of the challenges in Agriculture, igniting a passion for creating meaningful change.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Representative

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a smart Sales Representative for our newly established Egg Depot in Ikorodu, Lagos.
	In this role, you will drive sales, build customer relationships, and promote our egg products to retailers, wholesalers, and walk-in customers in the area.
	From generating leads to managing inquiries and ensuring timely delivery, you will play a critical role in the day-to-day success of our depot operations.
	The Ideal candidate should reside in Ikorodu, Lagos.


Key Responsibilities


	Actively promote and sell eggs to existing and potential customers within Ikorodu and nearby communities.
	Generate leads and convert them into repeat customers through excellent service and follow-up.
	Attend to walk-in customers, process orders, and manage inquiries effectively.
	Build and maintain strong customer relationships to drive customer loyalty.
	Monitor inventory levels and coordinate with logistics for timely delivery.
	Maintain accurate records of sales, customer interactions, and transactions.


Requirements


	Education: OND, HND, or any related qualifications.
	Experience: Minimum of 1 (one) year of experience with proven experience as a Sales Representative in sales, marketing or similar sectors.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple customer inquiries.
	Self-motivated and result-oriented and able to work with minimal supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary Package
	Opportunity for career growth and professional development.
	A Dynamic and supportive work environment.


Application Closing Date: 9th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs detailing why they are suitable for this role to: htsfarmshumanresources@gmail.com and copy (cc):hr@htsfarms.ng using “Sales Representative Ikorodu” as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Marketing Officer

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive Marketing Officer to support the growth of our new Egg Depot in Ikorodu, Lagos.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and executing marketing strategies to attract and retain customers, promote our egg products extensively, and increase brand visibility within the local market.
	You will play a key role in on-ground marketing activities, community outreach, and customer engagement. The ideal candidate must reside in Ikorodu, and be familiar with the local market dynamics.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement local marketing strategies to promote egg sales.
	Identify and engage potential B2B and B2C customers (retailers, supermarkets, restaurants, and households).
	Build partnerships with local businesses to drive depot traffic.
	Collaborate with the sales team to align marketing and sales goals.
	Conduct on-ground marketing campaigns (flyers, roadshows, local events, etc.)
	Monitor and report on market trends, customer feedback, and competitor activity.
	Track performance metrics and analyze campaign effectiveness.


Requirements


	Education: OND / HND / B.Sc in Marketing, Business Administration, or related fields.
	Experience: Proven experience in marketing, preferably in agro-based products.
	Must reside in Ikorodu.
	Strong communication, persuasion, and sales skills.
	Self-motivated, target-driven, and able to work under minimal supervision.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary Package
	Opportunity for career growth and professional development.
	A Dynamic and supportive work environment.


Application Closing Date: 16th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and a Cover letter detailing why they are suitable for this role to: htsfarmshumanresources@gmail.com using “Marketing Officer” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Company Driver

Job Location: Ikorodu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We seek a reliable and experienced Driver to join our team in Ikorodu, Lagos. The Driver will be responsible for transporting goods, staff, and equipment safely and efficiently, ensuring timely deliveries, and maintaining the vehicle in excellent condition.


Key Responsibilities


	Safely transport company goods, staff, and equipment to designated locations.
	Plan routes and meet delivery timelines efficiently.
	Adhere to all traffic rules and regulations while on duty.
	Conduct routine checks on the vehicle (oil, fuel, tires, lights, etc.) to ensure it is in good working condition.
	Report any vehicle faults or maintenance needs promptly to management.
	Keep the vehicle clean and organized at all times.
	Maintain accurate records of trips, mileage, fuel consumption, and vehicle servicing.
	Assist with loading and unloading goods as required.
	Communicate effectively with team members to ensure smooth operations.
	Ensure proper handling of company goods to avoid damage or loss.


Requirements


	Valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience as a professional driver.
	Familiarity with routes in Lagos.
	Ability to drive manual and automatic vehicles.
	Strong understanding of vehicle maintenance and basic repairs.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be punctual, trustworthy, and able to work with minimal supervision.


Benefits


	Competitive salary.
	A supportive and respectful work environment.
	Opportunity to be part of a growing and impactful organization.


Application Closing Date: 15th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: htsfarmshumanresources@gmail.com using “Company Driver Lagos” as the subject of the email.

title: Front Office & Revenue Manager Job at Alan & Grant
content:
Alan & Grant - Our client is a luxury community offering nature-inspired hospitality resorts, in suite wellness, relaxation and recreation experience for both residents and visitors.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Office & Revenue Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Rooms Division / Guest Services / Revenue Manager to lead all aspects of our guest-facing departments while strategically managing room inventory, rate optimization, and revenue forecasting.
	The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of hospitality operations, guest service excellence, and dynamic pricing strategies.


Key Responsibilities
Rooms Division & Guest Services:


	Oversee front office, housekeeping, concierge, and reservations departments to ensure flawless guest experiences across the estate
	Create and implement service standards and SOPs across all Rooms Division departments
	Liaise closely with Maintenance and F&B to ensure smooth room turnovers and guest comfort
	Monitor guest satisfaction and handle escalations with tact and professionalism
	Ensure seamless communication between departments to optimize service delivery and efficiency


Revenue Management:


	Strategically manage room inventory and pricing across all distribution channels
	Analyze market trends, competitor performance, and historical data to optimize Average Daily Rate (ADR), occupancy, and RevPAR
	Maintain and update all OTA and direct booking platforms; coordinate with marketing to ensure rate parity and correct visibility
	Prepare weekly, monthly, and quarterly revenue reports and forecasts for management
	Manage group and corporate booking agreements and identify upsell opportunities
	Optimize packages, discounts, and rate structures in line with seasonality and demand.


Requirements


	Degree in Hospitality Management, Tourism, Business, or a related field preferred.
	Minimum 5+ years of experience using Opera PMS 
	At least 5 - 7 years’ experience in hospitality, including revenue management, front office, or rooms division roles
	Strong understanding of hotel revenue principles, forecasting, and pricing strategies
	Proven leadership in managing cross-functional teams and guest-facing departments
	Proficiency with Excel and data analysis tools; ability to create and interpret financial and performance reports
	Familiarity with channel managers, OTAs, direct booking platforms, and rate parity tools
	Exceptional communication, leadership, and organizational skills
	Highly detail-oriented with a strategic and analytical mindset.
